summary: This is a legal motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team seeking to dismiss Counts Five and Six of the superseding indictment against her, arguing the alleged misstatements are not perjurious as a matter of law. The document identifies her attorneys and the court where the case is being heard.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, whose defense team is filing a motion to dismiss two perjury counts from the superseding indictment.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who signed and submitted the motion on behalf of the defense team.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney listed as part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team from Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney listed as part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team from Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney listed as part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team from Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Stemheim
persons.context: Attorney listed as part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team from her own law office.

Menninger is part of Maxwell's defense team representing her in the criminal case.

events.title: Filing of Motion to Dismiss Perjury Counts
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team files a motion to dismiss Counts Five and Six of the superseding indictment, arguing the alleged misstatements are not perjurious as a matter of law.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed a motion to dismiss Counts Five and Six of the superseding indictment against her.
The motion argues that the alleged misstatements forming the basis of these counts are not perjurious as a matter of law.
The document reveals Maxwell's defense team includes attorneys from multiple law firms: Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C., Cohen & Gresser LLP, and the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim.
The case is being heard in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York under docket number 20 Cr. 330 (MN).
